item.title: 15 Reasons 'CUZINZ' Make The Best Friends
item.description:
http://thoughtcatalog.com/kate-bailey/2014/01/15-reasons-cousins-make-the-best-friends

1. You act more like siblings than cousins, and more like best friends than siblings.

2. Family parties are infinitely more entertaining when you have a group of you who retreat from the holiday madness and just hang out and/or observe your hilarious relatives who never fail to live up to their dysfunctional reputations.

3. They understand the ins and outs of said dysfunctional family from which you all come, and you either have the exact same opinions on who is crazy and who is not or it’s your parents who are accusing one another of insanity in which case you avoid the issue altogether.

4. They know just how good your grandmother’s food is, and appreciate it with the kind of passion you expect everybody to.

5. They lost grandparents when you did, got baby cousins when you did, dealt with one family crisis after another all at the same time you did. They were the ones there celebrating with you at your highs and mourning with you at your lows. From that comes an unprecedented kind of companionship.

6. You’re distant enough that if you didn’t want to spend so much time together, you wouldn’t have to. But you choose to, and that’s what’s most important about your relationship.

7. There are ceaseless mentions of inside jokes and old memories from the vacations you took to birthday parties you attended and boyfriends/girlfriends you introduced to the family at the holidays so awkwardly for all those years.

8. Every one of you secretly believe they’re your grandparents’ favorite. That, or the favorite is undeniably obvious but everyone kind of accepts it because whatever, be the Kim Kardashian of the cousin brigade.

9. The age gap works in 10-year increments. The 20-somethings stick together, the teens stick together, the kids stick together.

10. Though there’s always that one younger kid who fits in with the older ones and everybody is somehow okay with it.

11. Because kidding aside, age couldn’t matter less.

12. You spent your childhoods with them, at their houses, with their parents as your seconds, playing comfortably in the presence of family but wildly in the company of kids who just get you. You would argue over toys and petty things like siblings because you knew at the end of the day, you weren’t going anywhere.

13. You know all about your respective parents’ drama with one another, and you usually just sit back and enjoy the show. Alternatively: you keep each other filled in on what’s going on with the aunt and uncle who are “going through a rough time right now.” Family drama is the best drama, but only when you’re the one gawking at it.

14. They were your first best friends. The rare kind of friends who remain close to you for so many years. You once would speak about your weddings and children and jobs and careers and would talk about how the girls would be each other’s bridesmaids and your kids would play together all the time, and now that the time is slowly creeping up on you, you wish you could go back to just playing in your grandparent’s basement with your new holiday gifts.

15. Because you’re more than just friends. You’re blood. The ties that bind you are deep, the pride and loyalty you have for your family fierce. A friend is someone who will be there for you when you call, a cousin is someone who will show up anyway because there’s food.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ponnasseril Family)

item.title: Thanksgiving Greetings and Pumpkin Pie
item.description:
TWAS THE NIGHT OF THANKSGIVING,
BUT I JUST COULDN'T SLEEP.
I TRIED COUNTING BACKWARDS,
I TRIED COUNTING SHEEP.

THE LEFTOVERS BECKONED -
THE DARK MEAT AND WHITE,
BUT I FOUGHT THE TEMPTATION
WITH ALL OF MY MIGHT.

TOSSING AND TURNING WITH ANTICIPATION,
THE THOUGHT OF A SNACK BECAME INFATUATION.
SO, I RACED TO THE KITCHEN, FLUNG OPEN THE DOOR,
AND GAZED AT THE FRIDGE, FULL OF GOODIES GALORE.
GOBBLED UP TURKEY AND BUTTERED POTATOES,
PICKLES AND CARROTS, BEANS AND TOMATOES.

I FELT MYSELF SWELLING SO PLUMP AND SO ROUND,
'TIL ALL OF A SUDDEN, I ROSE OFF THE GROUND.
I CRASHED THROUGH THE CEILING, FLOATING INTO THE SKY,
WITH A MOUTHFUL OF PUDDING AND A HANDFUL OF PIE.
BUT, I MANAGED TO YELL AS I SOARED PAST THE TREES....
HAPPY EATING TO ALL - PASS THE CRANBERRIES, PLEASE.

MAY YOUR STUFFING BE TASTY,
MAY YOUR TURKEY BE PLUMP.
MAY YOUR POTATOES 'N GRAVY HAVE NARY A LUMP.
MAY YOUR YAMS BE DELICIOUS.
MAY YOUR PIES TAKE THE PRIZE,
MAY YOUR THANKSGIVING DINNER STAY OFF OF YOUR THIGHS!!

HAPPY THANKSGIVING TO ALL

A BIG-shoutout goes out to Bavan, Erica, and Ranjit who tremendously worked hard in making this wedding a grand success!

item.title: CUZINZ meet with Erica and family!
item.description:
Yesterday, all of the cuzinz went off to New York City to go see Ranjit's new mate, Erica Vero, her sister, Carina, and family.

First, some of us stopped by at Sherry's house to meet up, and then eventually headed out into the city. Then at the apartment, we all got settled in, and had a chance to meet and converse with Erica and family. Then after that, some drove, some walked, while some took the cab to go bowling at Bowl-Mor Lanes where we met with the other half of the cuzinz there. After bowling, went for a nice, cold walk out into the city, especially through Washington Square Park, the Arch, and Fifth Avenue, where Sanu formerly lived during college years, and made a pit-stop at a Dunkin' Dounts for soothing refreshments. We all then went back to Ranjit's apartment to relax a bit before it was time to go back home. So overall, it was quite enjoyable hanging out with the cuzinz and getting to know Erica really well. Looking forward to the wedding where the entire family gets together, as well as many more to come!
Welcome to the family, Erica!!!
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ponnasseril Family)

item.description: Yesterday was the start of the new year, 2010, and as well as Sunil's 36th birthday. The party was held at the residence of Dinah and Chris. item.title: A Merry Ponnasseril Christmas 2009
item.description: Yesterday was, yep that's right, our family Christmas party held at Syosset. Our very own all the way from Colorado, Rekha, Sunil, and Jabin, spent their time with us. At Syosset, we did the usual greetings, prayers, food, tv, and chatting with our huge and loving family. There was a great deal of desserts, made by several cooks in the family. As well as, people were eager to open their secret santa gifts. Overall, it was one jolly and merry Christmas for the family to come together and have a fun-tastic time, especially with our Jabin and Abigail.

item.title: Family Onam Party 2009
item.description: Yesterday was our annual Onam party at Syosset. It started off with everyone coming in. Some people were playing cards, others were playing chess, and some talking or watching tv. Later on, it was time for dinner on banana leaves, in which the kids ate first, then the men, and finally the women. The food was completely vegeterian and delicious, made by our very own moms. After dinner, we had a special birthday cake surprise for Hannah's birthday. So after that, talked some more and hung out on the family staircase. Overall, it was another amazing experience to get a taste of Indian traditional culture.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ponnasseril Family)

item.title: 4th of July Weekend!
item.description:
Yesterday was the fourth of July, and we, cousins, spent the afternoon at the movies, in Brush Hollow, watching Transformers 2: Revenge of the Fallen at 3:40 PM. The movie was great, hillarious, and about two hours. While we all saw this movie, Swithin saw another movie, since he saw Transformers 2 already, which was twenty minutes longer than Transformers 2.

After the movie, we went to a barbeque cook-out at Bavan's house. While at the barbeque, we all ate, talked, and had two guests over from Bavan, Swithin, Sherry, and Shanu's church, Ancy and Vincy.

After eating, we all decided to go and shoot fireworks. So, behind Bavan's house, Shanu launched a firework, which eventually blew off course. So, we all went inside to eat some delicious apple pie. Then, went off to Ancy's house to launch some fireworks, which was pretty cool, especially the finale (the last couple of fireworks that we've had). Overall, it was an amazing 4th of July!
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ponnasseril Family)

item.title: Kunjumon's 60th Surprise Party!
item.description:
Yesterday, May 24, was Kunjumon(uncle)'s 60th surprise birthday party, where we all gathered at Priya's house to surprise him with a great surprise.

Anyway, along with the party, Bava(uncle)'s sister's and brother's family, from Kerala and Qatar, and greeted themselves to everyone at the gathering. After the surprise, people were talking here and there, upstairs and downstairs. Then, it was time for prayer, in which we sang two songs, Justin read Psalms 23, and Priya, Chris, and James(uncle) volunteered to pray for Kunjumon(uncle) and the rest of the crowd.

Following that, came the best part, cake cutting time for Kunjumon(uncle). After that, people served themselves with delicious Indian food, and some desserts, including Rekha's ordered variety of cheesecake slices. Anyway, overall, it was a fun experience for Kunjumon(uncle) and the rest of the family.

May God bless him in the future endeavors in his life, as turns 60!

Here are some pictures of the Surprise Party!
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ponnasseril Family)

item.title: "It has been one of those days."
item.description:
Here is an "amazing" article written by Sherry George, originally posted on Facebook, yesterday.

It's just been one of those day I felt the urge to share a bit of...

It’s been one of those days where my mind was just frazzled. I spent the morning finding work piled on top of work and little time. The morning traffic and the coffee spill were nothing. The Smart Board was on the fritz 7th period…it took forever, but it eventually started up. I went to 8th period completely having forgotten to make copies for the class.
I could go on with things that went wrong during the day… don’t even get me started on allergies.
It had just been one of those days.

I left work late. I walked to my car assessing work left to do, the students, the day, the job, life…you know, one of those natural progression of thoughts. In spite of the day, I couldn’t stop thinking about how much I love this life, and how blessed I feel with my everyday.
Completely engrossed in my thoughts, I ignored the paper on my front windshield as I got into the car. As I drove a block away from school, the paper caught my attention. I considered stopping and removing the flier but my feet were too tired to get up. I thought it could wait till I get home. Besides, I was getting great reception on the a radio station I really like today… “All God’s children sing ‘Glory, glory. Hallelujah, He reigns. He reigns.’” Who is this God who everyday fills me with more awe in view of his glory?

I got home and remembered to retrieve the ‘flier’ from the windshield. Good thing I had waited to read it. A woman wrote me a note, she and a few other parents who were around for the school baseball game had seen a white lexus hit my car when trying to park then jet away. After reading the note, I stared at the white paint scratch and dent on the side of my car.
A perfect dent.
A metaphor for my day that became tangible, taunting me to burst into frustration and anger. No anger. Where was the anger?
A smile.
What’s a dent in my life?
My God, He reigns.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ponnasseril Family)

item.title: Birthday Weekend Update!
item.description:
Yesterday, was Jabin's, and Roshan's, birthday party/barbeque.

It was a fun-filled event with food, fellowship with one another, and fun. Everyone were here and there, whether it be playing cards, playing with the little children, or even talking about different matters. Jabin was always playing with his bubble machine and his play-horse. The party ended with a short song, Bible reading by Christian (Psalms 93), and Jabin, Sarah, and Sanu praying. After the prayer, Jabin said to everyone "THANK YOU EVERYBODY". Overall, it was amazing and fun, especially for the little ones, including Jabin.

Also, today, there was a church prayer meeting at Swithin and Co's house to celebrate Swithin's birthday, which is tomorrow.

Here are some pictures of yesterday's event.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ponnasseril Family)

item.title: Easter Sunday Update!
item.description:
Christ Is Risen! Yesterday, was a beautiful and sunshine-filled day.

Anyway, it first started off with everyone greeting each other, especially with some special guests from Colorado, yes that's right, you guessed it, Rekha, Sunil, and Jabin! While everyone was chatting, Rekha happened to show everyone, on her laptop, their new house pictures.

After that, we all prayed together. While at prayer, we all sang two songs, then Jabin said the cutest thing ever, "Can we eat yet?", or something like that, read the Bible, and Sunil praying in the end.

After prayer, we all ate some delicious food prepared from some of the sisters and children, talked about different matters, and watched tv. As a special treat on Easter, it is usually tradition that we happened to eat Rekha's famous Easter Bunny cake, and do not forget Chef Jabin also took part in preparing the cake as well. After everyone being so full of luscious food, some were still chatting away, watching tv, and some played with Jabin and made him act out different sounds. Anyway, it was really nice to get to spend time with one another as a big, loving, and blessed family.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Ponnasseril Family)
